title: AI Regulation in Europe: From the AI Act to Future Regulatory Challenges. (arXiv:2310.04072v1 [cs.CY])
abstract: This chapter provides a comprehensive discussion on AI regulation in the European Union, contrasting it with the more sectoral and self-regulatory approach in the UK. It argues for a hybrid regulatory strategy that combines elements from both philosophies, emphasizing the need for agility and safe harbors to ease compliance. The paper examines the AI Act as a pioneering legislative effort to address the multifaceted challenges posed by AI, asserting that, while the Act is a step in the right direction, it has shortcomings that could hinder the advancement of AI technologies. The paper also anticipates upcoming regulatory challenges, such as the management of toxic content, environmental concerns, and hybrid threats. It advocates for immediate action to create protocols for regulated access to high-performance, potentially open-source AI systems. translated_title: 欧洲的AI监管：从AI法案到未来的监管挑战
translated_abstract: 本章对欧盟的AI监管进行了全面讨论，并将其与英国更加部门化和自律的方法进行了对比。文章主张采取一种混合的监管策略，结合了两种哲学的要素，强调需要敏捷性和安全港口以便于合规。文章认为AI法案是解决AI提出的多方面挑战的开创性立法努力，但也指出法案存在不足之处可能会阻碍AI技术的发展。文章还预测了即将面临的监管挑战，如有害内容管理、环境关注和混合威胁。文章呼吁立即采取行动，制定对高性能、潜在开源的AI系统进行受管制访问的协议。虽然AI法案是一个重要的立法里程碑，但它需要进一步完善和全球合作，以实现有效的治理。
tldr: 本文讨论了欧盟的AI监管以及与英国不同的部门化和自律方法。文章主张采取混合的监管策略，强调敏捷性和安全港口。AI法案是解决AI挑战的开创性立法努力，但需要进一步完善和全球合作。
